content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 575.4 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Commissioner is
the Commissioner of Mental Health. (b) Community support services are those
clinical, social, rehabilitative, related administrative and other mental
health and support services which are provided within the community and which
enhance community living skills while preventing the unnecessary
hospitalization of the seriously and chronically mentally ill individual who is
determined to be eligible for such services pursuant to section
575.6
of this Part. (c) Community support services program is a
comprehensive program of community support services established under the
jurisdiction of the Commissioner of Mental Health, funded by the Office of

Mental Health and administered through the local government plan. It is
designed to provide core services and a case manager system as essential
elements of an individual's service program for purposes of extending community
tenure and improving the quality of life. (d) Contract agency means a provider of
services, other than a local governmental unit, which contracts with the Office
of Mental Health to provide community support services. (e) Core services means the ongoing
management, coordination, and monitoring of the implementation of the community
support services program within a defined geographical area as determined in
the local government plan. (f) Core
service agency is a local governmental unit which receives community support
services funding or a provider of services which has contracted with a local
governmental unit to provide such core services. (g) Designated adult home means an adult care
facility, licensed by the Commissioner of Social Services pursuant to article 7
of the Social Services Law, which has been designated by the Commissioner of

Mental Health as containing a significant number of seriously and chronically
mentally ill individuals who are in need of community support
services. (h) Designated shelter
for the homeless means a shelter for the homeless, licensed by the Commissioner
of Social Services pursuant to article 7 of the Social Services Law, which has
been designated by the Commissioner of Mental Health as containing a
significant number of seriously and chronically mentally ill individuals who
are in need of community support services. (i) Designated single room occupancy
residence means a single room occupancy, as defined in the Multiple Dwelling

Law or the Multiple Residence Law, which has been designated by the

Commissioner of Mental Health as containing a significant number of seriously
and chronically mentally ill individuals who are in need of community support
services. (j) Direct contract means
a contract between the Office of Mental Health and a provider of services other
than a local governmental unit. Such contract shall require the provision of
specified units of community support services, administrative services or
management/monitoring services to be provided by the provider of services which
shall be funded by the Office of Mental Health. (k) Director means the director of community
services, who is the chief executive officer of the local governmental unit, by
whatever title known. (l) Functionally disabled means a severe, chronic disability which is caused by a
medically determined mental illness, as evidenced by a principal psychiatric
diagnosis, which is likely to continue for a prolonged period, and which
results in substantial functional limitations in three or more of the following
areas: self-care, social functioning, activities of daily living, economic
self-sufficiency, self-direction, and ability to concentrate. (m) Local government is a county, except a
county within the City of New York, and the City of New York. (n) Local government plan is the local
services plan, as defined in section
41.18
of
the Mental Hygiene Law, or the unified services plan, as defined in sections
41.19, 41.21
and
41.23
of
the Mental Hygiene Law. Such plan outlines current local or unified services
and contains a comprehensive proposal for the annual, intermediate and long
range plans and expenditures by the local governmental unit and by providers of
services pursuant to contracts with the local governmental unit. (o) Local governmental unit means the unit of
local government given authority in accordance with article 41 of the Mental

Hygiene Law to provide services in accordance with the local government plan
for the mentally ill. (p) Nurse is
an individual who is currently licensed as a registered professional nurse by
the New York State Education Department. (q) Provider of services means a local
governmental unit, voluntary agency, proprietary agency, association or
corporation which provides services for the community support services eligible
population. (r) Psychiatrist is an
individual currently licensed as a physician by the New York State Education

Department, who is a diplomate of the American Board of Psychiatry and

Neurology or is eligible to be certified by that board, or is certified by the

American Osteopathic Board of Neurology and Psychiatry or is eligible to be
certified by that board. (s) Psychologist is an individual who is currently licensed as a psychologist by
the New York State Education Department. (t) Qualified residence means a community
residence, residential care center for adults, family care home, or residential
treatment facility for children and youth which is licensed or operated by the

Office of Mental Health. (u) Social
worker is an individual who is either currently licensed as a certified social
worker by the New York State Education Department or has a master's degree in
social work from a program approved by the New York State Education

Department. Notes
